page.title: 03INDUSTRY GRAVEL PITS
page.content: The gravel pits are amajor industry of the North Hykeham area.The Butterley Aggregates pit has been established since 1930.The company employs 40 people in the area.From the pit they extract 150,000tonnes of sand and gravel a year.To excavate they use a pump mounted on a floating pontoon. Once extracted the materials are discharged onto a barge to be taken to the processing works where it is washed and graded.There are two types of sand,coarse sand for concrete and the other is used for brick and block work.There are three grades of gravel,a 40mm,a 20mm and a10mm. These are used for concrete,drainage work and other things. When the pit is worked out it will be landscaped and used for sport.
